h:
“Welcome every morning with a smile. Look on the new day as another gift from your Creator, another golden opportunity.” —
Og Mandino
q: Welcome every morning with a smile. Look on the new day as another gift from your Creator, another golden opportunity.

h:
“Don't let the behavior of others destroy your inner peace.” —
Dalai Lama
q: Don't let the behavior of others destroy your inner peace.

h:
“It's easy to be a critic, but being a doer requires effort, risk, and change. ” —
Wayne Dyer
q: It's easy to be a critic, but being a doer requires effort, risk, and change.

h:
“You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.” —
Wayne Gretzky
q: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.

h:
“Determine never to be idle. No person will have occasion to complain of the want of time who never loses any.” —
Thomas Jefferson
q: Determine never to be idle. No person will have occasion to complain of the want of time who never loses any.

h:
“Our greatest fears lie in anticipation.” —
Honore de Balzac
q: Our greatest fears lie in anticipation.

h:
“Strive for excellence, not perfection, because we don't live in a perfect world.” —
Joyce Meyer
q: Strive for excellence, not perfection, because we don't live in a perfect world.

h:
“People who avoid failure also avoid success.” —
Robert Kiyosaki
q: People who avoid failure also avoid success.

h:
“There is no value in anything until it is finished. ” —
Genghis Khan
q: There is no value in anything until it is finished.

h:
“To be fully alive is to feel that everything is possible.” —
Eric Hoffer
q: To be fully alive is to feel that everything is possible.

h:
“Growth is in a series of mistakes. That's the only way you learn.” —
Steve Harvey
q: Growth is in a series of mistakes. That's the only way you learn.

h:
“It is dangerous to be right in matters on which the established authorities are wrong.” —
Voltaire
q: It is dangerous to be right in matters on which the established authorities are wrong.

h:
“Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is God's gift, that's why we call it the present.” —
Joan Rivers
q: Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is God's gift, that's why we call it the present.

h:
“Within every desire is the mechanics of its fulfillment.” —
Deepak Chopra
q: Within every desire is the mechanics of its fulfillment.

h:
“It is indeed a radical act of love just to sit down and be quiet for a time by yourself.” —
Jon Kabat-Zinn
q: It is indeed a radical act of love just to sit down and be quiet for a time by yourself.

h:
“Be regular and orderly in your life, so that you may be violent and original in your work.” —
Gustave Flaubert
q: Be regular and orderly in your life, so that you may be violent and original in your work.

h:
“Only when one allows themself the right to die, do they then give yourself the permission to live.” —
C. Sean McGee
q: Only when one allows themself the right to die, do they then give yourself the permission to live.

h:
“Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.” —
Robert Frost
q: Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.

h:
“Either get busy living or get busy dying.” —
Stephen King
q: Either get busy living or get busy dying.

h:
“Life goes by very fast. And the worst thing in life that you can have is a job that you hate, and have no energy and creativity in.” —
Robert Greene
q: Life goes by very fast. And the worst thing in life that you can have is a job that you hate, and have no energy and creativity in.

h:
“Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.” —
Vince Lombardi
q: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.

h:
“Dreams do come true, if we only wish hard enough, You can have anything in life if you will sacrifice everything else for it.” —
James Matthew Barrie
q: Dreams do come true, if we only wish hard enough, You can have anything in life if you will sacrifice everything else for it.

h:
“You will have bad times, but they will always wake you up to the stuff you weren't paying attention to.” —
Robin Williams
q: You will have bad times, but they will always wake you up to the stuff you weren't paying attention to.

h:
“Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.” —
George Addair
q: Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.

h:
“We must not cease from exploration. And the end of all our exploring will be to arrive where we began and to know the place for the first time.” —
T.S. Eliot
q: We must not cease from exploration. And the end of all our exploring will be to arrive where we began and to know the place for the first time.

h:
“Trust, but verify.” —
Ronald Reagan
q: Trust, but verify.

h:
“Some people are old at 18 and some are young at 90. Time is a concept that humans created.” —
Yoko Ono
q: Some people are old at 18 and some are young at 90. Time is a concept that humans created.

h:
“When you say yes to change, you are choosing to navigate that path peacefully and happily and see where it takes you.” —
Sonia Ricotti
q: When you say yes to change, you are choosing to navigate that path peacefully and happily and see where it takes you.

h:
“Life is and will ever remain an equation incapable of solution, but it contains certain known factors. ” —
Nikola Tesla
q: Life is and will ever remain an equation incapable of solution, but it contains certain known factors.

h:
“By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.” —
Benjamin Franklin
q: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.

h:
“Those who are possessed by nothing possess everything.” —
Morihei Ueshiba
q: Those who are possessed by nothing possess everything.

h:
“Desire for the fruits of work must never be your motive in working.” —
Bhagavad Gita
q: Desire for the fruits of work must never be your motive in working.

h:
“Truth is like most opinions - best unexpressed.” —
Kenneth Branagh
q: Truth is like most opinions - best unexpressed.

h:
“What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson
q: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.

h:
“I have never let my schooling interfere with my education.” —
Mark Twain
q: I have never let my schooling interfere with my education.

h:
“Freedom lies in being bold.” —
Robert Frost
q: Freedom lies in being bold.

h:
“Make each day a new horizon.” —
Christopher McCandless
q: Make each day a new horizon.

h:
“Light a candle instead of cursing the darkness.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt
q: Light a candle instead of cursing the darkness.

h:
“The content of your character is your choice. Day by day, what you choose, what you think and what you do is who you become.” —
Heraclitus
q: The content of your character is your choice. Day by day, what you choose, what you think and what you do is who you become.

h:
“Imagination is the beginning of creation.” —
George Bernard Shaw
q: Imagination is the beginning of creation.

h:
“All you need is the plan, the road map, and the courage to press on to your destination.” —
Earl Nightingale
q: All you need is the plan, the road map, and the courage to press on to your destination.

h:
“Keep true. Never be ashamed of doing right. Decide what you think is right and stick to it.” —
George Eliot
q: Keep true. Never be ashamed of doing right. Decide what you think is right and stick to it.

h:
“The more reasons you have for achieving your goal, the more determined you will become.” —
Brian Tracy
q: The more reasons you have for achieving your goal, the more determined you will become.

h:
“When we think about our strengths, we are strong. When we think about our weaknesses, we are weak.” —
Peter A. Cohen
q: When we think about our strengths, we are strong. When we think about our weaknesses, we are weak.

h:
“Do not fight with pigs - you will be smeared in mud but the pig will like it.” —
George Bernard Shaw
q: Do not fight with pigs - you will be smeared in mud but the pig will like it.

h:
“I am always doing that which I can not do, in order that I may learn how to do it.” —
Pablo Picasso
q: I am always doing that which I can not do, in order that I may learn how to do it.

h:
“The mind can calculate, but the spirit yearns, and the heart wants what the heart wants.” —
Stephen King
q: The mind can calculate, but the spirit yearns, and the heart wants what the heart wants.

h:
“The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.” —
Mark Twain
q: The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.

h:
“Life is a gift. Never forget to enjoy and bask in every moment you are in.” —
Celestine Chua
q: Life is a gift. Never forget to enjoy and bask in every moment you are in.

h:
“People who belittle people, will be LITTLE people, and will accomplish very Little” —
Norman Vincent Peale
q: People who belittle people, will be LITTLE people, and will accomplish very Little
